briefdescription.para: LoRa initialization entry will initialize the CommBuffer, the PalState, the Scheduler and LoRa itself.

config
a lora Network configuration
RETCODE_OK: success, RECCODE_FAILURE: on error

briefdescription.para: LoRa Deinitialization entry will deinitialize the CommBuffer, the PalState, the Scheduler and LoRa itself.

detaileddescription.para: starts a LoRa join process
RETCODE_OK: success, RECCODE_FAILURE: on error
RETCODE_OK: join procedure successfully started RECODE_FAILURE: join error

briefdescription.para: function to transmit data through LoRa communication

detaileddescription.para:
loraPort
MAC payload port (must be > 0)
dataBuffer
MAC data buffer to be sent
dataBufferSize
MAC data buffer size
uint8_t 0: OK 1: Busy 2: No network joined 3: Length or port error 4: Unknown MAC command 5: Unable to find a free channel

briefdescription.para: Pauses the LoRaWAN stack functionality to allow transceiver (radio) configuration.

parameterdescription.para: pauseWAN: time interval in milliseconds that the transceiver can be used without affecting the LoRaWAN functionality.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: This command resumes LoRaWAN stack functionality, in order to continue normal functionality after being paused.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Puts the Radio device into listening mode for a specified period of time.

parameterdescription.para: Time in ms during which the module will have its receiver listening if 0 the module will listen indefinitely.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets Automatic reply on or off.

detaileddescription.para:
By enabling the automatic reply,the module will transmit a packet without a payload immediately after a confirmed downlink is received, or when the frame Pending bit has been set by the server. If set to OFF, no automatic reply will be transmitted.
autoReply
set to true if autmatic reply is to be enabled, set to false otherwise
RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Puts the LoRa module in sleep mode.

detaileddescription.para:
the command puts the module in sleep mode for the specified time duration and will return after the module has been waken up or if there has been an error
duration_ms
Time duration to sleep in ms
RETCODE_OK if the module is waken up error code othrewise

briefdescription.para: Switches OFF the LoRa module.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs the low level operations in order to power OFF * the module and release the physical link (SPI, UART, I2C,...) to the main CPU.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Switches ON the LoRa module.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs the low level operations in order to power ON the module and establish the physical link (SPI, UART, I2C,...) between the main CPU and the LoRa device.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Wake up the module from sleep.

detaileddescription.para:
if the module is in sleep mode a call to this function will wake it up.
In order to wake up the module this function has to be called from within the context of a task other than the one that called LoRaDevice_Sleep().
RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This file defines the Application programming interface for a LoRa.

detaileddescription.para: Interface header for the LoRa file.
This file defines the Application programming interface for a LoRa module The current API follows the LoRaWAN Specification V1.0.1
The functions specified herein should be implemented for each new module (if possible).
The user of this API has to check if the functions have been implemented for the intended hardware

The interface header exports the following features:
LoRa_Initialize
LoRa_Join
LoRa_TransmitData
LoRa_Deinitialize
